bboxes.raw_text:
"The Parent, The Teacher,
The Nurse = For The Health of
the Child" is the theme of
workshop to be held at Arizona
State University, Tempe. on Mon
day, April Is. 1864, at 4 pm. in
the ballroom Of the Student Union
Building.


Sponsored by Maricopa County
Health Department, 1t Is designed
primarily for PTA members,
school administrators, teachers,
and nurses. However," DR.. S.
F. Farnsworth, Department Dr.
rector, said eft will be open to
any other persons who are In
terested in the goals, RESPONSE
bilities and services Of the school
nurse in the school and COM
munity."


Miss Gertrude Cromwell,
School Nurse Consultant, Arizona
State Health Department, will
appear. Group discussions will
be summarized by DR.. Dorothy
Cillanders. professor of physi-
cal education, at a dinner at the
Student Memorial Union. John
Friday, Sunland School teacher,
is scheduled as main dinner
speaker.


Reservations for attending the
workshop must be made in ad-
vance and will be accepted
through Thursday, April s, 1864.
Persons interested in attending
should contact the Maricopa
County Health Department main
office, AL $685.

PALMBEACH, FLA.-Periodic
X-ray examinations Of all women
over 40 were urged as the only
means Of cutting the grievous
toll from breast cancer.


DR.. Jacob Gershon-Cohen Of
the Albert Einstein Medical Gen.
ter, Philadelphia, made the plea
in addressing the sixth annual
seminar for science writer's
spoons ored by the American Can
Ger Society.


He said that at present about
o5 per cent of all breast cancers
are first detected by the patients
themselves, and that at the time
they are spotted 90 per cent Of
them already have spread be-
yound the breast to the armpits.


Thus, he said, available cura-
tive methods such as surgery
= are forfeited in approximately
so per cent Of all cases.

WOMEN URGED


TO GET CHECK UP

NEW YORK United Negro
College Fund will open Its 18th
year Of continuous weekly broad
casts over ABC's network "Ne-
gro College Choirs" series with
a "Songs Of Nature" program.


The program will be presented
by the choirs Of eight UNCF
member institutions: Lane Col
lege, Jacks ION. Tenn, Xavier Uni
versity, New Orleans, La, Phil
ander Smith c ollege, Little Rock.
Ark. Spelman College and Nor
ris Brown College, Atlanta. Ca,
Stillman College, Tuscaloosa,
Ala, Livingstone College. Sails
bury, NC, and Barber-Scotia
College, Concord, NC.


A program will originate in
New York City, April S.

Superior Court Judge Ross
told Allen CAN'T, Jr., 81, 1904
w. Tonic, that he was vicious.


"The only thing to do with you
Is to take you out of society
where you can't harm people,"


CAN'T had pleaded guilty to
five armed robberies. He was
sentenced to three consecutive
prison terms Of $40 years each.


He robbed five people on Dec.
rs. More than ST 700 In loot was
recovered and returned to his
victims. He was captured on the
same day Of the robberies.

NEW YORK The New York
State Assembly reversed its
earlier decision and passed a
measure, March "a, to end dis
elimination against Negroes and
Puerto Ricans in apprenticeship
training programs.


Passage of this legislation was
one of the prime targets of the
recent March on Albany SPONSOR
ed by the National Association
for the Advancement of Colored
People.

Why is 1t that people label any proposal
which they do being product
munsm7 These people said that the
Russian They placed the stigma Of freedom
march in Washington. They have branded the Civil Rights
being communstc in substance


The Civil Rights BILL the contrary designed give liberties
minority which has long been denied these rights
sona liberty and freedom hand in hand freedom
any be able and without discrimination
have freedom Of conscience and power choice.
That great humanitarian and Patrick Henry asked
these liberties when he said "Cive liberty give
death. No rise today and say
prompted by though Of communsic deology To would
deny the very existence Of constitutions
The Civil Rights Bill liberties given to
the American Negro. The bill perfect passed.
is time that aside preudice party differences
umertcan and uChrisan deny the Negro his rights


Jim Jones


1920 No. End St.


Phoani Ari1

I & M BARBER SHOP
l205 w. Buckeye

SOUBLETS BEAUTY SHOP
20l4 E. Broadway
BR 6-3o64
